html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td div div span
content: Under the desert, investors are hoping to strike black gold

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font b span
content: Libya is moving ahead with plans to modernise its oil industry, holding talks with representatives from global companies in Tripoli on Sunday.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The country, which has recently mended international ties and has significant untapped oil reserves, is offering exploration rights on 15 sites.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Press reports estimate that as many as 20 international firms, including some from the US, took part in the meeting.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Further meetings are scheduled for London on 15 September, AFP reported.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Among the London attendees will be Anglo-Dutch oil giant Shell, which established an office in Tripoli in 2001 and signed heads of agreement to lay out the principles for doing business in Libya earlier this year.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: On Sunday, Libya laid out the terms of its tender process.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Bids for six offshore and nine onshore blocs have to be submitted by 10 January 2005. The winning bidders must enter production-sharing agreements with Libya's National Oil Corporation.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The move may mark a change in fortune for Libya as well as providing a new market for the oil companies involved.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi has managed to bring his country back into the international fold after years of seclusion and sanctions

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The North African nation was dramatically rehabilitated late last year after it publicly ditched its weapons of mass destruction programme, and declared a stockpile of chemical weapons to UN inspectors.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: UK prime minister Tony Blair visited Tripoli in April 2004. Mr Blair has claimed Libya's change of heart as a victory for British diplomacy.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The US resumed relations with Libya, and began buying Libyan oil again, in June 2004.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: For some of the firms, it is thought to be the first time they have officially been invited to the country since the lifting of sanctions.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The reports did not specify which firms attended the meeting.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: BP said it was monitoring the situation.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Drilling rig supplier Abbot Group said it would be focusing on Libya as it unveiled its interim results on Monday. The UK-based company already operates rigs in Libya.
